item.title: Recortes en servicios de idiomas generan temor a errores médicos, diagnósticos equivocados y muertes
item.description: Cerca de 69 millones de personas en el país hablan un idioma que no es inglés, y 26 millones de ellas hablan inglés, pero no con fluidez.

item.title: Language Service Cutbacks Raise Fear of Medical Errors, Misdiagnoses, Deaths

item.title: A Medicaid Patient Had a Heart Attack While Traveling. He Owed Almost $78,000.
item.description: Federal law says Medicaid must cover out-of-state emergency care. But a Florida man got a five-figure bill after a South Dakota hospital declined to c...

item.title: Silence on E. Coli Outbreak Highlights How Trump Team’s Changes Undermine Food Safety
item.description: Food safety inspections are being scaled back and the public was not notified after an investigation into E. coli contamination.
